name: Dansk Erhvervsinvestering
overview:
A / S Danish Business Investment (DEI) has since its establishment in 1983 was intended to invest in the Danish corporate sector to promote production, exports and employment in Denmark. The Company is in late 2006 transformed into a “closed-end fund” and shall no longer new investments.

DEI will through FondsmÃ¦glerselskabet LD Invest A / S, which the administration of the portfolio from the first January 2007 is out-sourced for the coming year to further develop the existing portfolio companies as possible for resale within a shorter, but not ultimately limited number of years.

Knowledge Resources DEI’s existing employees were transferred to LD Invest Room. 1st January 2007. Investment advice is handled by a separate department, LD Invest Equity, and DEI’s former employees are now fully integrated into this section. Business basis of LD Invest Equity impose specific requirements on employees’ skills and knowledge and the necessary specialist skills are available to DEI’s investment company.

There has been an administration agreement between the Danish Business Investment and Danish Innovation Investment (Dii), so DEI manages DIIS portfolio.
